document.title: Visual and Performing Arts Content Standards for California Public Schools, Prekindergarten Through Grade Twelve

FC2F9450DFE3013196F168A86D17958E.description: Discuss artists in the community who create different kinds of art (e.g., prints, ceramics, paintings, sculpture).

FC2EE1A0DFE3013196EF68A86D17958E.description: Identify pictures and sort them into categories according to expressive qualities (e.g., theme and mood).

FC2E4040DFE3013196ED68A86D17958E.description: Select and use expressive colors to create mood and show personality within a portrait of a hero from long ago or the recent past.

FC2DF840DFE3013196EC68A86D17958E.description: Use placement, overlapping, and size differences to show opposites (e.g., up/down, in/out, over/under, together/apart, fast/slow, stop/go).

FC2D5AA0DFE3013196EA68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in the Visual Arts to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC2D1140DFE3013196E968A86D17958E.description: Use appropriate vocabulary of art to describe the successful use of an element of art in a work of art.

FC2CC7F0DFE3013196E868A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of art to talk about what they wanted to do in their own works of art and how they succeeded.

FC2C2810DFE3013196E668A86D17958E.description: Compare different responses to the same work of art.

FC2BD1C0DFE3013196E568A86D17958E.description: Compare ideas expressed through their own works of art with ideas expressed in the work of others.

FC2B3360DFE3013196E368A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works in the Visual Arts

FC2AF0A0DFE3013196E268A86D17958E.description: Identify and discuss how art is used in events and celebrations in various cultures, past and present, including the use in their own lives.

FC2A67E0DFE3013196E068A86D17958E.description: Recognize and use the vocabulary of art to describe art objects from various cultures and time periods.

FC2A1AA0DFE3013196DF68A86D17958E.description: Explain how artists use their work to share experiences or communicate ideas.

FC29C380DFE3013196DE68A86D17958E.description: Role and Development of the Visual Arts

FC297E50DFE3013196DD68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of the Visual Arts

FC293B10DFE3013196DC68A86D17958E.description: Use bilateral or radial symmetry to create visual balance.

FC28F5E0DFE3013196DB68A86D17958E.description: Create a painting or drawing, using warm or cool colors expressively.

FC28ABE0DFE3013196DA68A86D17958E.description: Depict the illusion of depth (space) in a work of art, using overlapping shapes, relative size, and placement within the picture.

FC286580DFE3013196D968A86D17958E.description: Communication and Expression Through Original Works of Art

FC281560DFE3013196D868A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate beginning skill in the use of art media, such as oil pastels, watercolors, and tempera.

FC27C930DFE3013196D768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate beginning skill in the use of basic tools and art-making processes, such as printing, crayon rubbings, collage, and stencils.

FC271FB0DFE3013196D568A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in the Visual Arts

FC26D0B0DFE3013196D468A86D17958E.description: Identify the elements of art in objects in nature, the environment, and works of art, emphasizing line, color, shape/form, texture, and space.

FC2681C0DFE3013196D368A86D17958E.description: Analyze Art Elements and Principles of Design

FC2620F0DFE3013196D268A86D17958E.description: Perceive and discuss differences in mood created by warm and cool colors.

FC25ADC0DFE3013196D168A86D17958E.description: Perceive and describe repetition and balance in nature, in the environment, and in works of art.

FC2561A0DFE3013196D068A86D17958E.description: Develop Perceptual Skills and Visual Arts Vocabulary

FC251720DFE3013196CF68A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to the Visual Arts

FC246550DFE3013196CD68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate the ability to participate cooperatively in the different jobs required to create a theatrical production.

FC23CA70DFE3013196CB68A86D17958E.description: Use problem-solving and cooperative skills in dramatizing a story, a current event, or a concept from another subject area.

FC230F70DFE3013196C968A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Theatre, Film/Video, and Electronic Media to Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC22BD10DFE3013196C868A86D17958E.description: Identify the message or moral of a work of theatre.

FC226130DFE3013196C768A86D17958E.description: Derivation of Meaning from Works of Theatre

FC220CA0DFE3013196C668A86D17958E.description: Respond to a live performance with appropriate audience behavior.

FC21BEE0DFE3013196C568A86D17958E.description: Critique an actor's performance as to the use of voice, gesture, facial expression, and movement to create character.

FC2131A0DFE3013196C368A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Critiquing Theatrical Experiences

FC20E530DFE3013196C268A86D17958E.description: Identify universal characters in stories and plays from different periods and places.

FC2022F0DFE3013196C068A86D17958E.description: Identify theatre and storytelling forms from different cultures.

FC1FC6F0DFE3013196BF68A86D17958E.description: Role and Cultural Significance of Theatre

FC1F7CE0DFE3013196BE68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Theatre

FC1F2C30DFE3013196BD68A86D17958E.description: Create costume pieces, props, or sets for a theatrical experience.

FC1EDC40DFE3013196BC68A86D17958E.description: Use improvisation to portray such concepts as friendship, hunger, or seasons.

FC1E9480DFE3013196BB68A86D17958E.description: Retell familiar stories, sequencing story points and identifying character, setting, and conflict.

FC1DFA30DFE3013196B968A86D17958E.description: Perform in group improvisational theatrical games that develop cooperative skills and concentration.

FC1D5150DFE3013196B768A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Theatre

FC1CE7D0DFE3013196B668A86D17958E.description: Use body and voice to improvise alternative endings to a story.

FC1C8E80DFE3013196B568A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of the Elements of Theatre

FC1C4AC0DFE3013196B468A86D17958E.description: Use the vocabulary of theatre, such as plot (beginning, middle, and end), scene, sets, conflict, script, and audience, to describe theatrical experiences.

FC1C05C0DFE3013196B368A86D17958E.description: Development of the Vocabulary of Theatre

FC1BBA40DFE3013196B268A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Theatre

FC1B1950DFE3013196B068A86D17958E.description: Identify and discuss who composes and performs music.

FC1A6CC0DFE3013196AE68A86D17958E.description: Identify similar themes in stories, songs, and art forms (e.g., patterns, texture).

FC19DDC0DFE3013196AC68A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Music to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC198A10DFE3013196AB68A86D17958E.description: Use the terminology of music in discussing individual preferences for specific music.

FC190460DFE3013196A968A86D17958E.description: Respond to a live performance with appropriate audience behavior.

FC18C0F0DFE3013196A868A86D17958E.description: Identify how musical elements communicate ideas or moods.

FC187B50DFE3013196A768A86D17958E.description: Create developmentally appropriate movements to express pitch, tempo, form, and dynamics in music.

FC17E710DFE3013196A568A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Music

FC179590DFE3013196A468A86D17958E.description: Identify the uses of specific music in daily or special events.

FC16C280DFE3013196A168A86D17958E.description: Sing simple songs and play singing games from various cultures.

FC162D20DFE30131969F68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Music

FC15D800DFE30131969E68A86D17958E.description: Improvise simple rhythmic and melodic accompaniments, using voice and a variety of classroom instruments.

FC152270DFE30131969C68A86D17958E.description: Play rhythmic ostinatos on classroom instruments.

FC146F30DFE30131969A68A86D17958E.description: Sing with accuracy in a developmentally appropriate range.

FC13D800DFE30131969868A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Music

FC138E40DFE30131969768A86D17958E.description: Identify visually and aurally individual wind, string, brass, and percussion instruments used in a variety of music.

FC134420DFE30131969668A86D17958E.description: Identify simple musical forms, emphasizing verse/refrain, AB, ABA.

FC12E810DFE30131969568A86D17958E.description: Identify ascending/descending melody and even/uneven rhythm patterns in selected pieces of music.

FC1298E0DFE30131969468A86D17958E.description: Listen to, Analyze, and Describe Music

FC124390DFE30131969368A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform simple patterns of pitch, using solf√®ge.

FC11FE90DFE30131969268A86D17958E.description: Read, write, and perform simple rhythmic patterns, using eighth notes, quarter notes, half notes, and rests.

FC116CF0DFE30131969068A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception - Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Music

FC10CAA0DFE30131968E68A86D17958E.description: Describe how dancing requires good health-related habits (e.g., adequate nutrition, water, and rest; proper preparation for physical activity).

FC100D00DFE30131968C68A86D17958E.description: Development of Life Skills and Career Competencies

FC0FC650DFE30131968B68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate language arts concepts through dance (e.g., show different punctuation marks through movement).

FC0F7F80DFE30131968A68A86D17958E.description: Use literature to inspire dance ideas (e.g., poem, cartoon, nursery rhyme).

FC0EDDC0DFE30131968868A86D17958E.description: Connections, Relationships, Applications - Connecting and Applying What Is Learned in Dance to Learning in Other Art Forms and Subject Areas and to Careers

FC0E8780DFE30131968768A86D17958E.description: Describe the similarities and differences in performing various dances (e.g., direction changes, steps, type of energy and tempo).

FC0DF7C0DFE30131968568A86D17958E.description: Describe how the movement in dances of peers communicates ideas or moods to the viewer (e.g., ocean environment or a sad or joyous dance).

FC0DA340DFE30131968468A86D17958E.description: Use basic dance vocabulary to name and describe a dance observed or performed (e.g., levels, rhythm patterns, type of energy).

FC0D5400DFE30131968368A86D17958E.description: Description, Analysis, and Criticism of Dance

FC0D0890DFE30131968268A86D17958E.description: Aesthetic Valuing - Responding to, Analyzing, and Making Judgments About Works of Dance

FC0CB9B0DFE30131968168A86D17958E.description: Describe dances seen in celebrations and community events.

FC0C29B0DFE30131967F68A86D17958E.description: Name and perform rhythms from different cultures (e.g., through clapping, stamping, using whole body movement).

FC0BDF80DFE30131967E68A86D17958E.description: Explain commonalities among basic locomotor and axial movements in dances from various countries.

FC0B8690DFE30131967D68A86D17958E.description: Name and perform social and traditional dances from various cultures.

FC0ACFC0DFE30131967B68A86D17958E.description: Historical and Cultural Context - Understanding the Historical Contributions and Cultural Dimensions of Dance

FC0A8BB0DFE30131967A68A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate partner skills (e.g., imitating and leading/following).

FC0A47B0DFE30131967968A86D17958E.description: Work cooperatively in small and large groups.

FC0A0180DFE30131967868A86D17958E.description: Development of Partner and Group Skills

FC09B500DFE30131967768A86D17958E.description: Create, memorize, and perform original expressive movements for peers.

FC0903F0DFE30131967568A86D17958E.description: Develop a dance phrase that has a sense of unity.

FC08C160DFE30131967468A86D17958E.description: Create shapes and movements, using fast and slow tempos.

FC087E40DFE30131967368A86D17958E.description: Create a simple sequence of movement with a beginning, a middle, and an end, incorpo-rating level and directional changes.

FC083960DFE30131967268A86D17958E.description: Application of Choreographic Principles and Processes to Creating Dance

FC07F120DFE30131967168A86D17958E.description: Demonstrate multiple solutions in response to a given movement problem (e.g., In how many ways can you travel from point A to point B?).

FC07A050DFE30131967068A86D17958E.description: Create and improvise movement patterns and sequences.

FC070B10DFE30131966E68A86D17958E.description: Creative Expression - Creating, Performing, and Participating in Dance

FC06C660DFE30131966D68A86D17958E.description: Name a large number of locomotor and axial movements used in dance.

FC0632A0DFE30131966B68A86D17958E.description: Expand the ability to incorporate spatial concepts with movement problems.

FC05E2A0DFE30131966A68A86D17958E.description: Perform short movement problems, emphasizing the element of time (e.g., varied tem-pos, rhythmic patterns, counting).

FC058C00DFE30131966968A86D17958E.description: Comprehension and Analysis of Dance Elements

FC054730DFE30131966868A86D17958E.description: Show a variety of combinations of axial movements (e.g., swing and balanced shapes, turn and stretch, bend and twist).

FC050130DFE30131966768A86D17958E.description: Show a variety of combinations of basic locomotor skills (e.g., walk and run, gallop and jump, hop and skip, slide and roll).

FC04B980DFE30131966668A86D17958E.description: Development of Motor Skills and Technical Expertise

FC046EE0DFE30131966568A86D17958E.description: Artistic Perception ‚Äì Processing, Analyzing, and Responding to Sensory Information Through the Language and Skills Unique to Dance
